es.utils.mapper.factory.builder

Interface Transformer<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN,OUT>

  • Type Parameters:
    IN - the type of the origin object
    GETTER_OUT - the resulting type of the getter operation
    SETTER_IN - the input type of the setter operation
    OUT - the type of the destination object
    All Superinterfaces:
    Consume<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN,OUT>, DefaultOutput<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN,OUT>, To<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN,OUT>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DefaultInput<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN,OUT>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EMBuilder

    public interface Transformer<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN,OUT>
extends DefaultOutput<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN,OUT>
    Optional and repeatable step of the EMBuilder that allow to specify a transformer between the result of the getter and the input of the setter.
    Previous step: DefaultInput
    Next step: DefaultOutput
    Author:
    eschoysman
    See Also:
    builder package

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        <SETTER_IN_NEW> Transformer<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN_NEW,OUT> transform(ThrowingFunction<SETTER_IN,SETTER_IN_NEW> transformer)
        Add a transformer between the getter and setter operations.
        Be careful of NullPointerException, if the input of the transformer is null a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        SETTER_IN_NEW - the input type of the setter operation
        Parameters:
        transformer - a function to map the result of the getter into the correct type for the setter
        Returns:
        the next (optional) step of the builder: Transformer

      • transform

        <SETTER_IN_NEW> Transformer<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN_NEW,OUT> transform(Class<? extends AbstractConverter<SETTER_IN,SETTER_IN_NEW>> converter)
                                                                throws MappingException
        Add a transformer between the getter and setter operations using the given converter class.
        Be careful of NullPointerException, if the input of the transformer is null a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        SETTER_IN_NEW - the input type of the setter operation
        Parameters:
        converter - the class to instance to convert the the result of the getter into the correct type for the setter
        Returns:
        the next (optional) step of the builder: Transformer
        Throws:
        MappingException - if the given converter cannot be instantiate

      • cast

        default <SETTER_IN_NEW> Transformer<IN,GETTER_OUT,SETTER_IN_NEW,OUT> cast(Class<SETTER_IN_NEW> newType)
        Add a transformer between the getter and setter operations casting the value to the given type.
        Be careful of NullPointerException, if the input of the transformer is null a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        SETTER_IN_NEW - the input type of the setter operation
        Parameters:
        newType - the class to cast the the result of the getter into the type for the setter
        Returns:
        the next (optional) step of the builder: Transformer
